Flowery writing is filled with beautiful, poetic language. It often uses metaphors and similes to describe things in a creative, descriptive way.
A candid writing style is one that is honest and open. It is not afraid to reveal the writer's true thoughts and feelings on a subject.
A prosaic writing style is straightforward and simple. It is often characterized by simple, declarative sentences and a lack of extra detail.
An ornate writing style is highly decorative and complex. It often includes intricate sentence structure, flowery language, and a lot of detail.
A poetic writing style incorporates a lot of imagery and figurative language. It often has a lyrical quality to it, and can be quite emotional.

An inspirational tone is meant to inspire or motivate the listener.
A bleak tone is negative or depressing. It is characterized by feelings of hopelessness, despair, or cynicism.
A grim tone is harsh, dark, and foreboding. It is associated with death, violence, and other dark themes.
An ironic tone uses words to express something other than and especially the opposite of the literal meaning.
A satirical tone uses humor, irony, exaggeration, or ridicule to expose and criticize people's stupidity or vices.
A formal tone is an impersonal, objective, and dispassionate manner of writing or speaking.
An informal tone is a relaxed and friendly way of speaking or writing.
An assertive tone is one that is confident and direct. Assertiveness communicates a willingness to stand up for oneself and one's beliefs.
A passive-aggressive tone is passive but also covertly hostile and resentful. It is used to communicate displeasure or disagreement.

A fast-paced story moves quickly. The action in a fast-paced story is usually non-stop, and there is little time for character development or description.

A slow-paced story is one that takes its time in unfolding, often providing detailed descriptions and leisurely conversations. It is not action-packed, and instead relies more on its characters and setting.
An "Overcoming the Monster" plot is an underdog story where the hero sets out to destroy an evil of some kind.
A "Rags to riches" plot is a story in which a poor character becomes rich through their own hard work or some stroke of luck.
A "The Quest" plot is a story in which the protagonist sets out on a journey in order to find something or achieve a goal.
A "Voyage and return" plot is a story in which the main character leaves home, has an adventure, and then returns home.
A "Comedy" plot is a story that makes the audience laugh. Comedies are filled with funny characters, situations, or dialogues.
A "Tragedy" plot is a story in which the main character suffers from a major downfall. This can be caused by various factors such as pride, fate, or human error.
A "Rebirth" plot is a story where the characters are reborn into a new life with new perspectives or attitudes. This can happen after death or a major event that changes the course of their life.
Historical fiction is a genre where the plot takes place in a setting related to the past events, but is fictional.
Literary fiction is a category of fiction that deals with complex social and psychological matters and focuses more on character development than on plot or action.
Science fiction is fiction based on imagined future scientific or technological advances and major social or environmental changes.
Mystery is a fiction genre where the nature of an event, usually a murder or other crime, remains mysterious until the end of the story.
Dystopian fiction is a genre of literature that depicts future societies with undesirable social conditions.
Horror fiction is intended to frighten, scare, or disgust the audience.
